channel.title: Case Study on CURIOSS
channel.description: Recent content in Case Study on CURIOSS

item.title: Carnegie Mellon University CURIOSS
item.description: The Carnegie Mellon University Open Source Program Office (CURIOSS) was launched in July 2022. The office received a grant from the Alfred P.

item.title: Open Source with SLU
item.description: In July 2022, Saint Louis University (SLU) was awarded funding by the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation to launch its Open Source Program Office, Open Source with SLU.

item.title: University of Vermont VERSO
item.description: In 2022, the University of Vermont (UVM) was awarded funding by the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation to launch the VErmont ReSearch CURIOSS (VERSO).

item.title: CURIOSS UC Santa Cruz
item.description: In 2021, the University of California Santa Cruz (UCSC) was awarded funding from the Alfred P.

item.title: Johns Hopkins University CURIOSS
item.description: The Johns Hopkins University (JHU) Sheridan Libraries launched the JHU CURIOSS in 2019 as the first academic CURIOSS in the U.

item.title: Trinity College Dublin CURIOSS
item.description: Trinity College Dublin’s (TCD) CURIOSS was launched in 2020. The office is a division of Trinity Innovation within the university.

item.title: Open@RIT
item.description: Rochester Institute of Technology’s (RIT) Open@RIT office was launched in 2020 but their programs in Open Work date back to 2009 with its first course offering in Humanitarian Free and Open Source Software, which grew to be the only academic minor in the subject anywhere.

item.title: Empowering communities worlds apart
item.description: Executive summary Successful collaboration among three organizations—a community center, a university’s open source program office, and a government IT department—to deploy Lutèce, a modular open source platform designed for public support.

item.title: University Open Source Program Offices
item.description: The Sheridan Libraries at Johns Hopkins University (JHU) have launched the first US university-based open source programs office (CURIOSS).
